abstract: Amazon.com said that it sold 105 e-books for every 100 printed books, a milestone that its chief executive, Jeff Bezos, said had occurred sooner than expected.
snippet: Amazon.com said that it sold 105 e-books for every 100 printed books, a milestone that its chief executive, Jeff Bezos, said had occurred sooner than expected.
lead_paragraph: In the latest chapter in the unfolding tale of the book evolution from ink to pixels, Amazon.com said Thursday that its customers now buy more e-books than print books.

headline.main: E-Books Outsell Print Books at Amazon
headline.print_headline: E-Books Outsell Print Books at Amazon

byline.original: By Claire Cain Miller and Julie Bosman
